description: Construction of a single storey building to the rear for the purposes of a self-contained flat; boundary treatment including sub-division; cycle and refuse/recycle storage; private amenity space and hard/soft landscaping.
decision_conditions: The proposed dwelling, by reason its size, scale, bulk and design, siting and its lack of separation distance between the neighbouring properties would appear as a cramped and incongruous form of back land development which would be detrimental to the character, appearance and visual amenities of the street scene and the surrounding area. Therefore the proposal would be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHB 11, DMH 6, and DMHB 12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

The proposed dwelling and boundary treatments, by reason size, scale, bulk and design, siting and lack of separation distance between the neighbouring properties would result in detrimental impact upon the residential amenities of the neighbouring properties.  Therefore the proposal would be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHB 11 and DMH 6, of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020) and Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

The proposed new dwelling alongside the high level boundary treatment by reason of its lack of separation distance between the habitable room windows and the proposed boundary treatment would fail to provide adequate outlook, daylight or sunlight for future occupiers and would therefore result in inadequate living conditions. As such the application fails to comply with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies, policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

The proposal fails to provide adequate, accessible parking and cycle provision for both the new and existing properties, to the detriment of on street parking, amenity, highway and pedestrian safety.  As such the proposal fails to satisfy Policies DMT 1, DMT 2 and DMT 6 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 2 Development Management Policies (2020).
